briefdescription.para: Enum describing what kind of depth type the data should be organized as
Name of this grid sensor.
The width of each grid cell.
The depth of each grid cell.
The width of the grid .
The depth of the grid .
The height of each grid cell. Changes how much of the vertical axis is observed by a cell.
Rotate the grid based on the direction the agent is facing.
Array holding the depth of each channel.
List of tags that are detected.
The layer mask.
The data layout that the grid should output.
The reference of the root of the agent. This is used to disambiguate objects with the same tag as the agent. Defaults to current GameObject.
The total number of observations per cell of the grid. Its equivalent to the "channel" on the outgoing tensor.
The total number of observations that this GridSensor provides. It is the length of m_PerceptionBuffer.
The offsets used to specify where within a cell's allotted data, certain observations will be inserted.
Array of Colors used for the grid gizmos.
The height of the gizmos grid.
Whether to show gizmos or not.
The main storage of perceptual information.
The default value of the perceptionBuffer when using the ChannelHot DepthType. Used to reset the array/
Array of Colors needed in order to load the values of the perception buffer to a texture.
Texture where the colors are written to so that they can be compressed in PNG format.
Radius of grid, used for normalizing the distance.
Difference between GridNumSideZ and gridNumSideX.
Offset used for calculating CellToPoint
Bool if initialized or not.
Array of colors displaying the DebugColors for each cell in OnDrawGizmos. Only updated if ShowGizmos.
Number of PNG formated images that are sent to python during training.
Number of relevant channels on the last image that is sent/
Total Number of cells (width*height)
Half of the grid in the X direction
Half of the grid in the z direction
Used in the PointToCell method to scale the x value to land in the calculated cell.
Used in the PointToCell method to scale the y value to land in the calculated cell.
Array holding the dimensions of the resulting tensor
Array of positions where each position is the center of a cell.
List representing the multiple compressed images of all of the grids
List representing the sizes of the multiple images so they can be properly reconstructed on the python side

memberdef.argsstring: (string[] detectableObjects, int[] channelDepth, GridDepthType gridDepthType, float cellScaleX, float cellScaleZ, int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int observeMaskInt, bool rotateToAgent, Color[] debugColors)
memberdef.name: SetParameters

briefdescription.para: Sets the parameters of the grid sensor

parameterdescription.para: array of strings representing the tags to be detected by the sensor
array of ints representing the depth of each channel
enum representing the GridDepthType of the sensor
float representing the X scaling of each cell
float representing the Z scaling of each cell
int representing the number of cells in the X direction. Width of the Grid
int representing the number of cells in the Z direction. Height of the Grid
int representing the layer mask to observe
bool if true then the grid is rotated to the rotation of the transform the rootReference
array of colors corresponding the the tags in the detectableObjects array

briefdescription.para: Initializes the constant parameters used within the perceive method call
Initializes the constant parameters that are based on the Grid Depth Type Sets the ObservationPerCell and the ChannelOffsets properties
Initializes the m_ChannelHotDefaultPerceptionBuffer with default data in the case that the grid depth type is ChannelHot
Initializes the m_PerceptionBuffer as the main data storage property Calculates the NumImages and NumChannelsOnLastImage that are used for serializing m_PerceptionBuffer
Calls the initialization methods. Creates the data storing properties used to send the data Establishes
Clears the perception buffer before loading in new data. If the gridDepthType is ChannelHot, then it initializes the Reset() also reinits the cell activity array (for debug)
Gets the shape of the grid observation

simplesect.para: integer array shape of the grid observation

briefdescription.para: GetCompressedObservation - Calls Perceive then puts the data stored on the perception buffer onto the m_perceptionTexture2D to be converted to a byte array and returned

simplesect.para: byte[] containing the compressed observation of the grid observation

briefdescription.para: Perceive - Clears the buffers, calls overlap box on the actual cell (the actual perception part) for all found colliders, LoadObjectData is called at the end, Perceive returns the float array of the perceptions

simplesect.para: A float[] containing all of the information collected from the gridsensor

briefdescription.para: Finds the cell in which the given global point falls

simplesect.para: The index of the cell in which the global point falls or -1 if the point does not fall into a cell

parameterdescription.para: The 3D point in global space

briefdescription.para: Utility method to find the index of a tag

simplesect.para: Index of the tag in DetectableObjects, if it is in there

parameterdescription.para: The tag to search for

briefdescription.para: Gets the observation shape
Initializes the location of the CellPoints property

ChannelsToTexture - Takes the channel index and the numChannelsToAdd. For each cell and for each channel to add, sets it to a value of the color specified for that cell. All colors are then set to the perceptionTexture via SetPixels. m_perceptionTexture2D can then be read as an image as it now contains all of the information that was stored in the channels
Parses the array of colliders found within a cell. Finds the closest gameobject to the agent root reference within the cell

parameterdescription.para: Array of the colliders found within the cell
The index of the cell
The center position of the cell

briefdescription.para: GetObjectData - returns an array of values that represent the game object This is one of the few methods that one may need to override to get their required functionality For instance, if one wants specific information about the current gameobject, they can use this method to extract it and then return it in an array format.

detaileddescription.para:
A float[] containing the data that holds the representative information of the passed in gameObject
currentColliderGo
The game object that was found colliding with a certain cell
typeIndex
The index of the type (tag) of the gameObject. (e.g., if this GameObject had the 3rd tag out of 4, type_index would be 2.0f)
normalizedDistance
A float between 0 and 1 describing the ratio of the distance currentColliderGo is compared to the edge of the gridsensor
Here is an example of extenind GetObjectData to include information about a potential Rigidbody: protected override float[] GetObjectData(GameObject currentColliderGo, float type_index, float normalized_distance) { float[] channelValues = new float[ChannelDepth.Length]; // ChannelDepth.Length = 4 in this example channelValues[0] = type_index; Rigidbody goRb = currentColliderGo.GetComponent<Rigidbody>(); if (goRb != null) { channelValues[1] = goRb.velocity.x; channelValues[2] = goRb.velocity.y; channelValues[3] = goRb.velocity.z; } return channelValues; }

briefdescription.para: Runs basic validation assertions to check that the values can be normalized

parameterdescription.para: The values to be validated
The gameobject used for better error messages

briefdescription.para: LoadObjectData - If the GameObject matches a tag, GetObjectData is called to extract the data from the GameObject then the data is transformed based on the GridDepthType of the gridsensor. Further documetation on the GridDepthType can be found below

parameterdescription.para: The game object that was found colliding with a certain cell
The index of the current cell
A float between 0 and 1 describing the ratio of the distance currentColliderGo is compared to the edge of the gridsensor

inbodydescription.para: The observations are "channel based" so each grid is WxHxC where C is the number of channels This typically means that each channel value is normalized between 0 and 1 If channelDepth is 1, the value is assumed normalized, else the value is normalized by the channelDepth The channels are then stored consecutively in PerceptionBuffer. NOTE: This is the only grid type that uses floating point values For example, if a cell contains the 3rd type of 5 possible on the 2nd team of 3 possible teams: channelValues = {2, 1} ObservationPerCell = channelValues.Length channelValues = {2f/5f, 1f/3f} = {.4, .33..} Array.Copy(channelValues, 0, PerceptionBuffer, cell_id*ObservationPerCell, ObservationPerCell);

The observations are "channel hot" so each grid is WxHxD where D is the sum of all of the channel depths The opposite of the "channel based" case, the channel values are represented as one hot vector per channel and then concatenated together Thus channelDepth is assumed to be greater than 1. For example, if a cell contains the 3rd type of 5 possible on the 2nd team of 3 possible teams, channelValues = {2, 1} channelOffsets = {5, 3} ObservationPerCell = 5 + 3 = 8 channelHotVals = {0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0} Array.Copy(channelHotVals, 0, PerceptionBuffer, cell_id*ObservationPerCell, ObservationPerCell);

briefdescription.para: Converts the index of the cell to the 3D point (y is zero)

simplesect.para: Vector3 of the position of the center of the cell

parameterdescription.para: The index of the cell
Bool weather to transform the point to the current transform

briefdescription.para: Copies the data from one cell to another

parameterdescription.para: index of the cell to copy from
index of the cell to copy into

briefdescription.para: Creates a copy of a float array

parameterdescription.para: The array to copy from</parma>

briefdescription.para: Grid-based sensor.
